byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: Handful of Al Qaeda training camps have sprung up in Afghanistan, forcing American security and intelligence officials to consider threat they pose in terrorism landscape dominated by Islamic State and resurgent Taliban; resilience of group comes as surprise to American and Afghan officials; Al Qaeda's focus on United States as enemy is of particular concern.
lead_paragraph: Training camps have sprouted up in Afghanistan, leading to questions on whether they could again become breeding grounds for attacks on the United States.

headline.main: As U.S. Focuses on ISIS and the Taliban, Al Qaeda Re-emerges
headline.print_headline: Qaeda Revival in Afghanistan Surprises U.S.

snippet: Training camps have sprouted up in Afghanistan, leading to questions on whether they could again become breeding grounds for attacks on the United States.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
